Public MustInherit Class PrintSystemObjects Implements IDisposable
public ref class PrintSystemObjects abstract : IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of print system objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you derive a class from <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObject>, you may want to derive a collection of objects of that class from <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects>.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects>. The <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose> method leaves the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects> object's <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose> method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose> invokes the protected <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose%28System.Boolean%29> method with the unnamed Boolean parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects.Dispose%28System.Boolean%29> with the parameter set to `false`.
When the Boolean parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjects> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

block.para:
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/ddae83kx(v=vs.100)).
